fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently in JIRA, if customer is using parallel Sprint in single board and used Sprint Health gadget, it'll only show the detail of the oldest Sprint details.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add support for parallel Sprint so JIRA can show detail from multiple Sprint in Sprint Health gadget.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Add support parallel sprint for Sprint gadget

fields.description:
I've read the documentation about how Atlassian doesn't approve of subtask roll up due to the varying accuracy of things in the backlog and inaccuracy of velocity but our team does not care. The fact that this does not work is monumentally annoying for the way our team works.
 *There should be an option to enable this even with an asterisk and an "are you sure" dialogue box and a link to why it's horrible.* 
 If this already option already exists can you please tell me where, I've looked.

Some people create subtasks with estimates and refuse to give the parent task an estimate because the "remaining estimated time" for the parent task *becomes equal to "parent task estimate + total subtask estimate"*. Other people would prefer the sprint board and burndown to contain data for all tasks with subtasks. There is no middle ground for the two unless this feature is enabled.
fields.summary: Sub-task roll up

fields.description:
Current, only 3 fields can be added on card layout for both backlog and sprint views

 

I am re-opening this issue to see if there is any more interest in it
fields.summary: Allow more than 3 fields on card layout

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when user closed all the sub-task in board, JIRA will prompt user to ask whether the parent task should be closed as well. User would like function to able to alter the pop-up so they can set the preferred status to the parent task with the pop-up.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add option in in the pop up so user can select the status of the parent task when all the sub-task is closed.

h3. Workaround 

None.
fields.summary: Customise sub-task closing message

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if an issue can not be ranked higher in a swimlane, the action is not executed but there is no warning message to explain why is the move not possible

h3. Suggested Solution
To improve the user experience, please add warning message

 
h3. Workaround 
-
fields.summary: Add warning messages if an issue can not be ranked higher on the board

fields.description:
h1. Story

As a Product Manager, I want to be able to represent my end-to-end lifecycle in a single board, so that I can more effectively keep track of my projects.
h1. Expansion

Our team is currently going through a periodic review and optimisation of our end-to-end development processes. One of the things we've found is that, in order to represent the full lifecycle of a project (conception, development & test, user acceptance, launch and on-boarding activity), we're creating more and more Agile boards which each focus on a different "stage" in the process.

Looking at the division of "Stages" in Portfolio as an example, with Team or Project-focused planning, it would be _really_ useful to be able to setup and configure a single agile-board which represents those different stages.

As an example, I currently have 3 agile boards for 1 project:
 # Ideation & Design
 ## Kanban board which is used to prioritise and track pre-development work, especially important when I'm pulling-in ad-hoc role, such as Designers and Architects for short-term engagements
 # Development & Test
 ## Scrum board which is used by the development & test teams to develop features and functions following User Stories and addressing Bugs
 # UAT & Launch 
 ## Kanban board which is used to track UAT and Launch activity following completion of development milestones / checkpoints using external constituents who aren't dedicated to the project or long-tail activity such as customer on-boarding following software release

I could envisage a "meta-board" which, perhaps follows or mimics my Portfolio stage configuration, combines several Agile Boards into a single place/link/menu option, separating the different boards using tabs, and includes a good summary tab empowering project overview, health and statistics.
fields.summary: Agile Boards - Consolidated Stage Boards

fields.description: Kanban Boards should offer additional charts for analyzing throughput an cycletime. Histograms could help a lot here. For example like this: https://kanbanize.com/blog/premium-histograms/
fields.summary: Kanban charts for throughput

fields.description:
The newest way of doing forcasting is using the [Monte Carlo Method|http://scrumage.com/blog/2015/09/agile-project-forecasting-the-monte-carlo-method/].

JIRA Software should include Charts for creating Monte Carlo simulations as a new way of forecasting. [Kanbanize has added this to their charts|https://kanbanize.com/blog/monte-carlo-simulations/], which I see a serious competitor to JIRA Software. Atlassian needs to up their game in developing new Kanban features.
fields.summary: Monte Carlo simulation for Scrum/Kanban Boards

fields.description:
Kanban Boards should also offer a chart for Release Burndowns including forecasting. Instead of sprint velocity it should open/resolved issues per day as a metric, including the dosplay of added work after the release start.
I currently have to create these charts in Google Sheet, but from a premium priced Kanban Software I expect to have this functionality out of the box.

 !Screen Shot 2017-02-22 at 19.27.52.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Release Burndown for Kanban Boards

fields.description:
Currently the Control Chart only shows the median (50% percentile) as a value above the chart. Normally Kanban scatter plot charts also display the percentile for 25, 75, 85, 95 and 99% which are also shown as lines in the chart. This should be added to the JIRA Control Chart.

[Kanbanize has added this to their charts|https://kanbanize.com/blog/premium-cycle-time-scatterplot/], which I see a serious competitor to JIRA Software. Atlassian needs to up their game in developing new Kanban features.
fields.summary: Add 25/75/85/95/99% percentile to Control Chart

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15615].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when moving the issue to another project also the Sprint information is copied 

h3. Suggested Solution
Customer is suggesting that the issue should be removed from Sprint automatically before moving it to another project
 
h3. Workaround 
remove issue from Sprint manually before moving the issue to another project
fields.summary: Remove issue from Sprint before moving it to another project

fields.description:
We use some of our agile boards to track different issue types that each form part of a larger process. Each issue type will sit in a different position in the process, but may have common statuses.

For example, a development sub-task will sit before a testing task on the board, but both would use a status of "In Progress".

In this scenario, Ideally, we would like to allocate "In Progress" for a Development Sub-Task to a different board column to "In Progress" for a "Test Sub-Task".

At the moment our workaround is to use distinctly named statuses (Eg In Progress (Dev); In Progress (Test)), but using common statuses would be preferable as it would make reporting and filtering easier
fields.summary: Allow Agile Board Columns to be based on both Issue Status and Issue Type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15613].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Sub-Task Estimation that is linked to a parent Story that is part of an active sprint is then moved to a new parent that is added to the sprint after start (Parent Story is a registered Scope Change event), the sub-tasks are also counted as scope change and the Estimate is doubled for each sub-task moved, as it does not ever Burn Down when removed from the original parent only burning up when it is added as a scope change event.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software Server
* JIRA Cloud Tested in v1000.773.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set Estimation Statistics to "Story Points"
# Set Time Tracking to "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent"
# Create Story with Subtasks that have estimation
# Add this parent issue to a planed Sprint
# Start the sprint
# Add a new Story without Subtasks to the Sprint (This is an intentional Scope Change event)
# Move a subtask from the Parent issue in the sprint at the time the sprint started to the new parent that is registered as a scope change event
# View the *Burndown Chart*

h3. Expected Results
Same behavior as Moving a Subtask between two Parent Issues that existed in the sprint at the time the sprint started the Estimation is not effected and continues to burn down as issues are completed

h3. Actual Results
the Sub-tasks are also treated as a scope change event and the estimation is doubled for every sub-task moved to the new parent issue, as they are not removed from the original estimation 
!Screen Shot 2017-02-21 at 5.37.07 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes:
If the issues are already counted as burn up, Move them back to the original Parent, this will not trigger an additional burn up but the value will still be inflated.

h3.Workaround
If adding in intentional scope change for a story, make sure to move any subtasks to the issue before adding it to the active sprint to trigger a burn down with the sub-tasks before triggering the burn up with the parent and the sub-tasks together
fields.summary: Sub-task Time Tracking Doubled when added to new parent issue in active sprint

fields.description:
I'm struggling to differentiate between the 'Time Spent' and the 'Remaining Values' Legend and associated curves on the burndown chart. This is because I am (along with a few other people on my team) red-green colorblind. Is it possible to change the color of these curves?

FWIW - Do a Google search and you will find 8 to 10% of the male population is color blind with red/green being the most common (8%). It would be very wise if you didn't use these colors by default...

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_blindness]

"Red–green color blindness affects up to 8% of males"
fields.summary: Change the color combination for 'Time Spent' and the 'Remaining Values' in Burndown Chart report

fields.description: Development of ClouDocs.io webservice.
fields.summary: ClouDocs Devs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15608].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
_ctrl+left_ click on the issue key on the board is not opening the issue in a new browser tab. The issue is reproducible in both Scrum and Kanban board.

h3. Environment
JIRA Agile v1000.324.0

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Access any board with issues
# ctrl+left mouse click on the issue key of the card

h3. Expected Behaviour

The issue will be opened in a new browser tab

h3. Actual Result
The issue is not opened in a new browser tab

h3. Workaround
Right click on the issue key and select _Open link in a new tab_
fields.summary: Issue is not opened in a new tab when using ctrl+left click

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

JIRA has different ways of saving changes. While board configuration doesn't need to be saved, when you edit a card you have a *Save* button and in the card panel view, you have 'tick' or an 'X' to apply or not the changes, for example.

*Suggested Solution*

Adopt a pattern to save changes.
fields.summary: Too many different ways of saving changes

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

It's not possible to make a JIRA Agile board public in JIRA Software Cloud.

*Suggested Solution*

Make it possible to a user to view the board accessing the board's URL without having to log in, by granting the Browse Project permission to _Anyone_ group and setting the board as _Shared with the public_.

*Workaround*

Access the instance's URL > Projects > View all projects > Select the project to view the issues.
fields.summary: Making a board publicly available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
User wants to have the ability to have the Epic Link field auto-filled with preset values when creating x or y issue type
h3. Suggested Solution
We suggested the user to set a validator in the utilized workflow so that the Epic Link field needs to be filled in order for the transition to occur. However, the user feels that this should be a feature of the system. Check the informed related case for details.
h3. Why this is important
User needs their JIRA Software users to have this field auto-populated when creating the issues so their reporting is not compromised.
fields.summary: Auto-set Epic Link to a preset value when creating a certain issue type

fields.description:
Example 1 (look for red arrows near column name0:

!image-2017-02-17-12-21-34-229.png!

 

Example 2:

!image-2017-02-17-12-23-12-014.png!
fields.summary: Add sorting option to columns in Administration tab.

fields.description:
I'd like to have possibility to export all definitions of custom fields to single file. The most important details are: type, field contexts, values. As JIRA administrator  I'm often asked by users for this information. It's really painful to manually open each of 350 custom fields (our instance is large-scale) and create screenshots of their configuration.

Best Regards,
Leszek
fields.summary: Export definition for all custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Sprint Health Gadget is not respecting the Global Time Tracking of JIRA.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Health Gadget based on a board using Original Time Estimate.
# Create issues in a Sprint in the board and estimate them.
# Change the Global Time Tracking to be 
#* Working hours per day: 24
#* Working days per week: 7
# Perform re-index
# Check the Gadget

h3. Expected Results
The values of the issues should be reflected in the Gadget.

h3. Actual Results
The Values in the gadget will remain unchanged, while the actual value of the issues will be reflecting different ones.
 
h3. Notes
Seems like the Gadget is using 8/5 format and ignoring the Global Time Tracking.

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget is not respecting the Global Time Tracking

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The current behavior of JIRA Software Reports is that they only consider issues to be closed when they have a resolution and are in the rightmost column of the JIRA board.
It would be interesting to be able to customize which columns to select when viewing reports in JIRA. Sometimes the user need separated columns with all his "completed" statuses.
h3. Suggested Solution
Create a customization box in the reports to provide the customer the ability to select which status/columns should be considered done.
fields.summary: Change behavior of Reports in JIRA Software to customize the Completed issues selection

fields.description:
I just want open an issue from the Kanban board i.e. view it at its own URL. This used to be possible, with CMD+click on the issue.

Now clicking an issue on the Kanban board just opens the tiny, shitty side bar view of the issue which is too small to allow edit / update of the issue.

In the past I always avoided using this shitty little view by opening the issue in its own page, BUT the recent update to Kanban board now prevents this.

Nobody wants to view and edit an issue in a tiny, shitty pane like this.

Don't prevent users from opening the task in its own page! Issues have their own URLs for a reason! .. e.g. so we can link to them / edit / leave comments / upload attachments

this is terrible UX design.
fields.summary: Opening issue from Kanban board is broken
LENDY

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

After cloning, the wizard continues to move the issue, but in order to keep the cloned issue where it is and with the same issue type, you have to cancel the wizard. There is no clear option to not move or keep the issue type the same.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a checkbox for keeping the cloned issue in the same project and add a checkbox for keeping the issue type the same after cloning.
h3. Why this is important

It is confusing for users who aren't sure what they are actually canceling.
fields.summary: Not moving an issue unclear with clone issue wizard

fields.description:
Users who have notification type set to 'text' in their preferences, should have a note displayed at the top of the email saying this message has been converted to text based on your user preference. I'm sure this would alleviate some confusion for other users not familiar with this feature, and why the emails look the way they do (unformatted).

 

As many users are currently using JIRA (as a customer-role) and not actuall familiar with the settings, I'm sure it would be appreciated that a message like this be displayed for clarity of why their email looks the way it does.
fields.summary: Add a note to email delivery when delivery type is 'text'

fields.description:
Hi,

 

we need to edit (add custom fields) to a *Create Linked Issue* dialog box.

How can I do that?

Thank you!

 

Lenka Chabicovska
fields.summary: Edit the Create Linked Issue dialog box

fields.description:
Missing API to fetch data for Lead Time, Cycle Time through ControlChart JIRA API.

I can a Greenhopper Control Chart API but it doesnt have any documentation of how its response should be treated as (rather than just mentioning application/json).

[https://jira.devops.mnscorp.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/controlchart?rapidViewId=1&swimlaneId=2&view=reporting&chart=controlChart&days=7]

OR this xboard API but it doesnt cater to any filters:

[http://jira.[MY-DOMAIN].com/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData/?rapidViewId=[ID]

 

Also - there should be a REST API to get information to calculate Lead Time and Cycle Time based upon rapidBoard, swimlane, quick filter and date ranges - similar to control chart graph on JIRA portal - APIs are always better as many clients can fetch details and analyse and work upon the same in their own way - similarly I want to do for my projects.
fields.summary: Missing API to fetch data for Lead Time, Cycle Time through ControlChart JIRA API
Website Home Page

fields.description: Ability to link Trello cards to JIRA tickers
fields.summary: Ability to link Trello cards to JIRA tickers
Pluto

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Completing sprint in JIRA 7.0 moves unresolved issues to backlog instead of next planned sprint

h4. Steps to reproduce the problem
# Have an active sprint with few unresolved issues
# Plan the next sprint in the same board
# Click on complete sprint

h4. Expected result
Unresolved issues should be moved to the next planned sprint, as mentioned in the documentation [Completing a sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER070/Completing+a+sprint].
{quote}
Any issues not completed at the end of the sprint will be moved to the next planned sprint. If you do not have a next planned sprint, they will be returned to the Backlog.
{quote}

h4. Actual Result
Issues are moved to backlog, even when there is a next sprint planned in the board


h4. Resolution
This has been fixed in JIRA Software 7.1.x where there is option that the user can choose whether to move the unresolved issues to backlog or certain next sprint.
fields.summary: Completing sprint in JIRA 7.0 moves unresolved issues to backlog instead of next planned sprint

fields.description:
Steps to repro.
 # Find 2 test issues in a simplified JIRA workflow + agile board
 # Click on the first issue
 # Type GG on the keyboard
 # Select the "Close" transition
 # Verify that the ticket got transitioned and moved into the correct column
 # Click on the second issue
 # Type GG on the keyboard
 # Select the "Close" transition

Expected:

Second issue is closed

Actual:

First issue is closed again
fields.summary: Closing 2 tickets from GG interface in Board doesn't work
New PR

Hope it helps,

 

Regards,

 

Enrique.

fields.description:
Suggestion to update the Manage Filters section to add the filter commands such as the "New filter" on in this section.
 For instance, the New filter command is available in the Search for issues  and not in the Manage filter one. It would be very useful  to have it in the Manage filters section also.
fields.summary: Enhance GUI regarding Filters Management

fields.description: Unable add attachments using drag and drop
fields.summary: Unable add attachments using drag and drop

fields.description:
I noticed this week after a JIRA upgrade that the issue navigator export to CSV current fields changed the data being exported. We just moved to 7.3 on Tuesday night. Before the change the assignee was the full name of the resource and the epic link was the name given to the epic link. After the change the assignee now uses the username and the epic link uses JIRA number assigned.

For example:
Before:

Assignee – Bill Smith
Epic Link – Vendor Files

After:

Assignee – bsmith
Epic Link – ETLENCSCRU – 7

How do I get the original values from the before example?
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Navigator Export CSV Current Fields

fields.description:
Good day!

We would like to improve security level.
 It would be convenient to adjust the level of visibility using a filter.

Example:
We set JQL filter for project / group / user. This JQL filter limits the visibility of issues.

user has the configuration
{code:java}
JQL : project = TEST AND createdDate >= startOfDay(){code}
and user has access to view / edit only issues belonging to the mask with combined filter. (In the project =  test and by today)
fields.summary: Security level to tasks by JQL

fields.description:
Today, even in JIRA Software 7.3, if user marks an Epic to be Done, using Mark as Done option from a scrum board, the Epic Status will be updated to Done, but this has NO relationship in whatsoever format with the Status of that Epic.

I know that in some case, some may want them separated, but looking into an overall concept, it's really somehow counter intuitive to a user that an Epic is marked as Done continues to have some not-done Status, like In-Progress to To-Do. 

And currently, JIRA doesn't have any trivial way to map them together, say if Epic Status is mark Done, I want to move the Status to Closed, for ex.

Is there any better way to do it without going to some more plug-in?
fields.summary: Allow Status of an Epic to be synchronously updated along with Epic Status

fields.description:
First - we love the new ability to see the 'Assigned To' of the test execution, so thanks for that from you or Zephyr.

 

What we are missing is the 'Reporter' of the Test to be exposed in the Search Test Executions screen.   We have an 'Owner' of the test back in the 'Reporter' of the test.   But if we want to see all of the test executions for the tests that I wrote/reported - I can't filter or search by that.

 

Thanks, hopefully something you can look into.

Shawn Steinbrunner

METTLER TOLEDO
fields.summary: Search Test Executions with Zephyr

fields.description:
We've often wanted to bulk edit all of the issues in a specific epic (e.g. to re-assign, modify the components or labels, version, etc.)

You can do this by creating a new issue search and filtering for the epic, but it could be MUCH easier:

I'd like a "View in Issue Navigator" link action in the Epic details screen, much like the one on the backlog view to view all issues in a given sprint or on the backlog.

Mocked-up screenshot:

!image-2017-02-09-10-30-39-065.png!
fields.summary: Link on Epic details to open an issue search of all contained issues for bulk editing

fields.description: Testing Jira Project
fields.summary: Testing Jira Project

fields.description:
*Problem statement*

Currently, users are not able to rename the Issue Link section that is presented when accessing an issue on JIRA

*Suggested Resolution*

Allow editing the name from this section
fields.summary: Allow users to rename the Issue Link session on issue view

fields.description:
At the moment, "Split Issue" is only available from right clicking an issue on the Kanban backlog, so if an issue is on the Kanban board, it can't be split and you either have to use Clone or change to the Backlog view to use it.

If the issue is already "In Progress" that means moving it back to Selected for Development first.

Please make Split Issue available in all views and from the "." shortcut menu.
fields.summary: "Split Issue" available everywhere

fields.description:
I have a custom field that I would like to edit how it is rendered when exporting to CSV. I already have templates for XML and the column-view, but these are not getting applied when exporting to CSV. This can also be applied to the RSS and Word export.

JIRA v7.2.6
fields.summary: Allow to format the CSV export for custom fields

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, in version drop down list (in version report), all versions belong to projects that are retrieved in the board will be shown. Even those versions that do not have any issues associated to them

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to exclude versions that are not associated with the issues in the board from the drop down list
fields.summary: Having the option to list down versions (in version report) that are associated with issues in the board

fields.description:
The translation of "Fix Versions" in French currently is "Version(s) cible(s)" which means "Target Versions" instead of "Fix Versions".

Customer requested to correct the translation.
fields.summary: "Fix Versions" field translation to French is incorrect

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, It is only possible to change board avatar. If the board only filters one project, it will follow project's avatar. However, when the board retrieves multiple project, it will not have board avatar, and it's not possible to configure it. 

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to to change board avatar. This is helpful in identifying specific board when a project is being retrieved in multiple boards, it will be easier to identify using board icon.
fields.summary: Having the option to change board avatar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is currently now possible to create multi-level swimlanes in JIRA. 

h3. Suggested Solution
To have something like a multi-project view, meaning the top level of the swim-lane is Projects and then as a second entity a new sub swim-lane Epics. It could also be part of the Board settings configuration screens. 

h3. Why this is important
It will be very useful for people and companies who are working on multi projects altogether since it will give real orientation on all levels what is critical to be done for the current week, and also to properly track the finalizations of all epics and projects.
fields.summary: Allow multi-level swimlanes

fields.description: When I want to print cards the description of the issue is lined up in one row. The result is cutting the description when the card 'area' ends. I need to manuelly insert 'enter' in the description to get it all out on the card. It would be better if this was automatic.
fields.summary: Show the whole description when printing cards

fields.description: Currently, the user directory synchronisation job is a periodical job calculated based on the JIRA startup time and the interval. It will be really useful if we can schedule this operation with a calendar, we prefer to run the job out of the production hours since it is kind of expensive operation.
fields.summary: Allow to schedule the user directory synchronisation job

fields.description: Our group has several domains for different purposes, we are using our JIRA to support them via separate projects. We definitely need the ability to have a per Project base URL setting so that links go back to the right location for branding purposes.
fields.summary: Per-Project base URL for JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently if you switch to view in issue navigator it switches to JQL which uses the version id instead of the version name. Due to the fact the version id is more specific to the project and version names could apply to other projects. 

i.e.
!instanceurl.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow version id as a basic search value or when toggling View in issue navigator preserve the version name instead of replacing it with the version id. 
h3. Why this is important
This prevents users to toggle back to basic search without replacing the id with the version name. 
h3. Workaround 
Replace the id with the version name.
fields.summary: 'View in issue navigator' should use the version name instead of the version id.

fields.description: When we are in edit Issue mode could you re-organize the screen? Sub-Tasks are below attachments and Issue Links - could this screen be re-order to Sub-Tasks is directly underneath description?
fields.summary: Re-organise Issue display

fields.description: Update Issue summary field to be of type text area, previously when a user clicked into the Issue summary field the full text box became available for edits. With version 7.2.7 only one line is displayed and users cannot see past the width of the box without scrolling:
fields.summary: Update Issue Summary field to be of type text area

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The JIRA subversion plugin no longer actively maintained according to the market place:
{quote}
This plugin is no longer being actively developed, and there are no plans to make it compatible with JIRA 7.4 or above.

If you'd like to work on the plugin, you can fork the source code repository on Bitbucket

For a complete integration with Subversion repositories we recommend using JIRA with FishEye, an integrated solution for source browsing and tracking. 
{quote}

Some customers feel that FishEye is oversized for their needs.

h3. Suggested Solution

Continue maintaining the JIRA subversion plugin for compatibility with JIRA 7.4+
 
h3. Workarounds

- Use FishEye
- Fork and maintain your own version of the plugin
- Use a different plugin from the marketplace (many are also unmaintained though)
fields.summary: Continue maintaining JIRA subversion plugin

fields.description: InstaRnD
fields.summary: InstaRnD

fields.description:
*What?* Allow admins to set the default 'Activity' tab to either 'All', 'Comments', 'History', etc.

*Why?* Because when the view defaults to 'All' or 'History' it makes communicating through JIRA comments burdensome and inefficient.

*How?* Add it to the screen configurations, or global settings. Or even a personal user preference.
fields.summary: Allow admins to set the default 'Activity' tab

fields.description:
The epic burndown report does not look at the sprint history an issue, but rather the time that sprints belonging to the board were started. The most recently started sprint at the point when the issue is resolved is chosen as the sprint to display. A sprint belongs to the board if it was created on that board, or if any issue on the board is in that sprint.

There some situations where the ticket may fall to 2 or more sprints, it chooses the one it belongs to.

It will be more clear if the Epic burndown shows the issues in the created sprint even if it was completed (the issue and the sprint) on the same day, different to show on the most recent sprint started.
fields.summary: Epic burndown is reporting items completed in different sprint

fields.description: I have my agile board set to swimlane based on epics, which my teams love. However I've noticed that epics without stories don't show at all, making it easy to lose track of things if you're attempting to build out an epic from the board. It would be nice to add a toggle onto the "Swimlane" screen to turn off this functionality so that empty epics still show as swimlanes, just with no tickets in them.
fields.summary: Show Epics with No Stories on Kanban Board When Swimlanes are Based on Epics

fields.description:
*Problem Statement*

Currently, users can only choose between a few statuses on Releases. It might be useful to allow users to define new statuses that might better represent the current status from the releases.

*Suggested Resolution*

Add the possibility to create workflows specifically for releases, adding the same features from a regular workflow and allowing users to see all the transition history from releases.
fields.summary: Allow users to define new statuses for Releases

fields.description:
There is no sprint information in the API referenced in JSW-9928

Which is here:
[https://docs.atlassian.com/greenhopper/REST/cloud/#agile/1.0/issue-getIssue]

It still comes in the custom field, not in a field called sprint, and is not formatted correctly.
fields.summary: Missing sprint information in REST API results
Allow searching by last commit date

fields.description:
h3. Problem

In the workflow of our issues, we are allowed to create a Scrum board for a specific project. And from there, we may plan a Sprint and include some of the issues into the list. Hence, while some of the issues are inside the Sprint, some may be left out as a Backlog. However at the moment, there's no Condition to restrict the execution of a workflow transition if an issue is not part of an active Sprint.

h3. Suggestion
It will be great if we can add a workflow condition to check if an issue is part of a Sprint, and restrict the execution of a workflow transition if the issue is not part of a Sprint.

h3. workaround
None
fields.summary: Validate if Issue is part of a Sprint in a Workflow

fields.description:
Currently there's no good method to see when LexoRank Balancing starts, stops or what condition triggered the job. It'd be useful to have this when trying to troubleshoot LexoRank related problems.
 * Log entry for when LexoRank Balancing starts
 * Log entry indicating what conditions triggered the balancing job
 * Log entry with periodic updates on balance state / percentage complete
 * Log entry for when LexoRank Balancing completes, including length of time for job to complete.
fields.summary: Default Logging for LexoRank Balancing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Portfolio "Team" field isn't available to be added in the Board _Issue Detail View_

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to have the Portfolio "Team" field on the _Issue Detail View_
 
h3. Workaround 
-
fields.summary: Make the Portfolio "Team" field available on the Board Issue Detail View

fields.description: It would be great, if this could be added, so i could so for a specific version whether there are open bugs affecting this version. the would imply, that i don't need to care about new filters for each release.
fields.summary: As a project leader i'd like to see "affected version" bugs in the release window

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The Jira # (issue key) was moved to the far right away from the Summary. This is causing me to have to scan my eyes back and forth from the summary to the number and back again when on this page. This is particularly bad during planning meetings and perhaps the worst repercussion from the recent change in the boards feature.

h3. Suggestion
Move the Jira number back to the far left next to the Summary.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Change the Issue Key side on boards

fields.description: In project settings it would be great to have an overall status option. There is no mechanism for providing updates directly into Jira such as 'on track' 'overdue' 'project close out' etc
fields.summary: Overall project status option
Application to build resume

fields.description:
Hi,

We are on JIRA Cloud and I am trying to find information related to customizing the Action Menu so we don't have to select "More Actions..." to clone or resolve issues. I've reviewed all of the available docs and I only find answers related to the *ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-operations* property. Can you help me?

 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Customize Action Menu in Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no possibility to save a favorite link in JIRA (except for favorite dashboards and filter)

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to save favorite links 

h3. Why this is important
Seeing a project report requires to navigate to the report itself to check it. The customer would like to have a quick link to access it
fields.summary: As a User, I would like to add favorite links for quick access (example, link to specific report)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, in order to search for issues that belong to more than one sprint, the users need to specify the sprint IDs in the issue navigator:
E.g: sprint in (1,9)

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if JIRA provides a search function to search for open issues that were added to more than n sprints. 
OR
Query for issues that created before the particular sprint and are still not in
Complete/Done status

h3. Why this is important
It is important to see if the team is following the concept of finishing the user story during one sprint. By having this ability, the manager or the admin can see if the user stories are too big to complete in one sprint. This also would help to check the user is moving those particular issues from one sprint to another.
fields.summary: Ability to search for open issues that belong to more than one sprint

fields.description:
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the behavior for custom fields displaying in tabs in the view issue screen isn't clearly defined in documentation.

Specifically they do not properly display unless they meet the following criteria:
 
- All of the tabs have custom fields on them (including the default Field Tab).
- At least one of those custom field types must not be a Date or People type (as those will show up in their respective sections in the view issue screen).
- At least one of those custom fields must have a value.


h3. Suggested Solution
Clearly define the behavior in documentation and possibly add this to "Where is my field" admin helper.

h3. Why this is important
 It is hard to isolate the root cause without testing and causes unnecessary user friction to isolate the point of failure.
fields.summary: Clarify tab and custom field documentation visibility criteria

fields.description:
Please provide details in documentation that how Attachments work in Data center.

 

If we increase the size limit, will it impact performance?
fields.summary: Attachments in Data center - how it works

fields.description:
I recently figured out how to add multiple options in the "Add Parameters to Validator" screen.  

I was not able to figure out how to do this from the example text in  the workflow screen and want to provide a suggestion for changing the text to help the next person trying to add this to their workflow.  Based on the text in the workflow screen (see screenshot), I had tried various permutations of the word "Option" and putting my values in quotes — Option [A,B], [A,B], Option ["A", "B"], "Option [A,B]", etc.

 

JIRA Cloud currently says:  
 * *Option [A,B]* would allow a selection of options: Option A, Option B or both.

Suggestion: 
 * *(A|B)* would allow a selection of options: Option A, Option B or both.

 

Note: I did not validate the "or both" option as my field is a single-select list. I also did not test the other examples for number/character options to determine if parenthesis should be used instead of brackets.

This information would have save me a lot of time and may be a benefit to others.
fields.summary: Syntax change suggestion for example in "Add Parameters to Validator" in Jira Cloud workflow screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When calling the REST API endpoints starting with {{rest/agile/1.0/board}} the value set for the parameter maxResults is not taken into account if it is bigger than '50' (it always return 50). The parameter startAt works fine instead.

h3. Environment
Cloud version 1000.718.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Call any {{agile/1.0/board}} endpoint passing a value for maxResults that is lower than 50
# See that this works fine. E.g. https://NAME.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/ID/sprint?startAt=20&maxResults=20 {noformat}
{
  "maxResults": 20,
  "startAt": 20,
  "isLast": false,
  "values": [ .......
{noformat}
# Call the same endpoint passing a value for maxResults that is bigger than 50. E.g.
#- https://NAME.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/1/sprint?startAt=20&maxResults=70 


h3. Expected Results
The maxResults value in the REST response is correctly set to the desired value


h3. Actual Results
maxResult is always set to 50
{noformat}
  "maxResults": 50,
  "startAt": 20,
  "isLast": true,
  "values": [.....
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The same issue reproduces calling:
- /rest/agile/1.0/board
- /rest/agile/1.0/board/ID/project
- /rest/agile/1.0/board/ID/epic
- /rest/agile/1.0/board/ID/sprint


h3.Workaround
Use the startAt parameter to get all the results
fields.summary: maxResults values bigger than 50 are not taken into account when calling /rest/agile/1.0/board REST API endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When Subtask is not set to have Story Point, it still shows the estimation in a board. As a user, I want it to be hidden for all Subtasks.
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to hide estimation field for Subtask in Active Sprint view
fields.summary: Hide estimation field for Subtask in Active Sprint view

fields.description: Our teams are prioritizing Epics, not just Stories, to allow us to develop and document a highere level plan that covers more than 3-4 Sprints.  This prioritization can be accomplished by moving Epics above and below each other in the Team Board where we manage the Stories.  However, it is very difficult to re-order a number of Epics because the width of the Epic panel is fixed.  If there Epic panel were resizable, like the Story Detail panel, it would be extremely useful.
fields.summary: Resize the Epic Panel in a Jira board Backlog view

fields.description:
Hi,

We would be interested in seeing a way to include multiple projects in a JIRA agile gadget, like the "Created vs Resolved Chart", but with the project data separated into multiple lines. Currently, you can add a filter with multiple projects, but the data from the projects is combined into a single line (there is only one Created line, only one Resolved line). There is some interest from our users in seeing multiple projects overlaying each other (4 lines: project 1 created, project 2 created, project 1 resolved, project 2 resolved) in order to easily compare data across projects.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Display multiple projects separately in one gadget graph

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Burndown Chart shows a Backdated event when work was logged and the remaining time was edited

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue and add it to a Sprint 
# Add Original estimation of 0m and Remaining estimation 0m
# Edit the Original estimation to 4h and Remaining estimation to 4h
# Log work to the issue 4h
# Check the Burndown Chart for this issue 

h3. Expected Results
Burndown shows correct information


h3. Actual Results
The burndown chart first shows a negative value

 
h3.Workaround
First plan all the estimations for the issues and add the issues to the Sprint. Then Start the Sprint:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/planning-sprints-764478112.html
fields.summary: Backdated event in JIRA Burndown chart when work has been logged to an issue and the remaining time was edited

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian,

I have got multiple projects and want to show them in 1 project (1 board). 

Is this possible?

 

All the project use the same swimming lanes.
fields.summary: Multiple project on 1 board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA only allows build in custom fields to be shown in agile board issue details view.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add support for third party customfield plugins so JIRA can display customfield from third party in issue detail view as well.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Show third party customfield in agile board issue detail view

fields.description:
As a scrum master I would like to see the "total commitment and completed work" on the velocity chart so that I can see how much of the original commitment from sprint planning was achieved. 

Acceptance:

In other words, if stories change in size, ignore the new size and if stories are added after sprint start, ignore the stories.

A third bar is added to the chart for each sprint "total commitment and completed work".

Details:

This is important for a SM to see as it tells us a lot about whats happening in the sprint planning.

Some teams add stories to the sprint after the start and the current view of original commitment and completed may look fine, but the actual commitment was not achieved. Unfortunately the velocity chart currently hides this.
fields.summary: velocity chart to show original commitment completed
CPC Example
Ability to restrict inline creation of Fix Versions, but still allow usage of field

fields.description:
While I can accept this has likely been requested in the past already, and possibly multiple times, I am worried that the responses from purists maybe blocking the development of this feature. I've listened to their arguments. However, based on years of experience, I submit that the inability to have multiple backlogs for a single project is stifling progress.

Once created, the purists can select one backlog anyway.. either way they will be happy. But for the many of us who move in and out of the box, we're limited in our planning and deployment. Time is wasted when a backlog simply becomes too large, and takes too long to sift through for Sprint planning, and in the end, we end up using an external tool anyway. So, either way, we are going to use multiple backlogs, and it would be preferable to have them all in the one location.
fields.summary: Ability to create multiple backlogs in a single project

fields.description:
Per my discussion with @philip, we are going to start using Drip for automated campaigns to people who primarily use the tool but also to people who we have in our database that we are trying to convert to become paying financial customers.

Here are the tasks at hand for the dev team:

1) Integrate Zoomer & Drip --> make sure any info submitted in zoomer including every form answer turns into a subscriber in Drip. The answers to their questions should be made into user attributes. 

2) Place Drip Pixel (log in for Drip account sent to Philip) --> This pixel should be placed on every single page including every web flow page and every zoomer page. THIS IS VERY IMPORTANT! I will submit a ticket to Drip to see what advice they have for webflow. 

3) Create user events --> Each subscriber should trigger an event for 1) Starting the form and 2) Submitting the form at a minimum. But I also want to know how many other pages they have viewed so that should be an attribute/event as well. Basically anything we consider an event in Mixpanel should also be one in drip. 

4) Create User Attribute for custom tool URL --> I need to be able to include the subscriber's unique link to the plan they made with the tool in a lot of these email so please make sure that custom attribute is included. 

Let me know if I can provide any guidance or clarification! 

Drip Help Docs: https://www.drip.co/docs
fields.summary: Integrate Drip with Truelink Database and Webpages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Can't select "+ Create issue" if it's open on a different Epic
h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.526.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a board with at least 1 epic.
# Select backlog on the left menu.
# Select epic A.
# Select epic B.
# Click on "+ create issue".

h3. Expected Results
The cursor to write the issue name should appear and create the issue.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing will happen as it was never clicked to create the issue.

h3.Workaround
Select again epic A, do not create a new issue, and select epic B, then create an issue.
fields.summary: Can't select "+ Create issue" if it's open on a different Epic

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

At the moment, if the number of story points is high, the line of the chart will be hidden by the legend of the burn down chart:
 !image.png|thumbnail!
h2. Suggested Solution

It would be great if users have the ability to hide or show the legend of the chart
OR
the legend is placed outside of the chart so that all the lines can be properly viewed

OR

the legend is relocated to the bottom left as graphs are very unlikely to drop to zero at the very beginning:
fields.summary: Legend of burndown chart overlaps the chart information

fields.description:
As a JIRA Administrator, I would like to be able to disable the new capability of project admins to modify a project's workflow (introduced in JIRA Software 7.3) so that I can ensure the integrity of already existing:
 * filters
 * gadgets
 * dashboards
 * reports
 * Confluence pages that get info from JIRA

as many of them can (and will) be broken when they were built with the previous workflow statuses in mind.

Therefore, this capability needs to be controllable at different levels:
 # *Instance* (ON - OFF)
 # *Global permission*: control group(s) of users eligible to have this capability in projects.
 # *Project permissions*: ** new permission to be added to the permission scheme.

Note that level 2 seems to be redundant due to the existence of level 3, but it isn't really:

It should be possible to grant the new permission to a project role, and, simultaneously, not effectively granting the permission to a user that doesn't belong to the group of people set on level 2.

That's specially relevant when you don't want some project admins to be able to have this ability, but they could add themselves to the project role which grants this ability.

Also note that adding a group to the permission scheme instead wouldn't solve the problem.

So, for a user to be able to have this ability, all 3 levels should be true.
fields.summary: Way to disable the modification of a workflow by project admins

fields.description:
h3. Problem
We have recently realized that all of the information about a given JIRA Issue isn't actually exported when all fields are selected, no matter the format. The main items that are missing are the source code commit information (branch, commit hash, commit message, etc.) that the JIRA/Bitbucket integration provides.

h3. Solution
We would appreciate from to have a way to export the commit hashes that are linked to a JIRA Issues when we do perform the Issue exports.

h3. Workaround
Get that information on the database, although this is not possible on Cloud environment
fields.summary: Let commit hashes be exported from JIRA to Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When a column contains issues which reach the max number, the column will be colored red (Kanban Board).
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/configuring-a-board/configuring-columns#ConfiguringColumns-SettingColumnConstraints

As a user, I'd like a feature that could block any issue to be moved in if the max number of issues is reached.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to block issues to be moved in if the max number is reached
fields.summary: Provide an option to block an issue to be moved in if the max number is reached

fields.description:
As a Product Owner, displayimg a human-readable rank (1, 2, 3, etc.) on the cards in the backlog would make prioritizing stories easier.  This especially applies to larger backlogs.  

Use case: 
{quote}When we're ranking large numbers of new stories with the our customer in a planning meeting, we need to be able to quickly place these stories in the Top 20, Bottom 20, etc.  Having a human readable number that reflected the stories position on the backlog would help with this.  At present, we have to count these groupings by hand.{quote}

!column.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Display human-readable the rank on the card in the backlog.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, in the create issue screen, project field will be pre-filled based on the previous page the user viewed or worked on. To Reproduce:
# Open a scrum board  
# Create an issue by pressing C or the create issue button (e.g pre-filled project: ABC)
# Add issue to the sprint
# Open a new tab and open any issue of project DEF
# Go back to scrum board in (1)
# Create another issue and the pre-filled project now is DEF

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if JIRA Software has the ability to pre-fill project based on the current page the user is working on. This can be implemented to a board that contains only one project.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to pre-fill project based on the current page in create issue screen
UI Design

fields.description:
We just completed a sprint and all the incomplete issues are supposed to be carried over to the next sprint, however we found that 6 of these issues ended up in the backlog.  When we tried to move them manually to the new sprint, they would immediately be moved back to the backlog again.  We've tried dragging it to the sprint in the backlog, and manually editing the sprint field on the issue, however each time it will appear to have been added successfully, but once the page is refreshed it's back in the backlog again.  

Looking at the history of the issue shows that the Sprint field has indeed been updated, but then it immediately reverts back to a blank value (see attached screenshot for example).
fields.summary: Can't assign some issues to a sprint
